titles.ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ أَنْ يُقَصَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ ظُفُرٌ أَوْ شَعْرٌ
titles.en: Chapter 27 – Abhorrence of cutting the nails and the hair from the deceased

titles.ar: باب مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ بَعْدَ أَنْ يُغَسَّلَ
titles.en: Chapter 28 – What comes out from the deceased after having been washed

titles.ar: باب الْمَرْأَةِ تَمُوتُ وَ فِي بَطْنِهَا وَلَدٌ يَتَحَرَّكُ
titles.en: Chapter 26 – The woman dies and in her belly is a moving child

titles.ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ أَنْ يُقَصَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ ظُفُرٌ أَوْ شَعْرٌ
titles.en: Chapter 27 – Abhorrence of cutting the nails and the hair from the deceased

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: سكت عنه - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/331)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يُمَسُّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ شَعْرٌ وَ لَا ظُفُرٌ وَ إِنْ سَقَطَ مِنْهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ فَاجْعَلْهُ فِي كَفَنِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from one of his companions,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Do not touch from the deceased, neither hair nor a nail, and if something falls off from him, so make it to be in his shroud’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from certain persons of his people who has said the following: “Abu ’Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Nothing of the hairs or nails of a deceased is touched and if any of such things fall off, you must place them in his shroud.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن أو موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/332)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ غِيَاثٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَرِهَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( صلوات الله عليه ) أَنْ تُحْلَقَ عَانَةُ الْمَيِّتِ إِذَا غُسِّلَ أَوْ يُقَلَّمَ لَهُ ظُفُرٌ أَوْ يُجَزَّ لَهُ شَعْرٌ .

en.hubeali: From him, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Giyas,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> disliked shaving the pubic hair of the deceased when washing, or clipping a nail of his, or shearing his hair’.
en.sarwar: 2. It is a narration from him (narrator of previous Hadith) by his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from Ghiyath who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has stated this Hadith. ‘’Amir al-Mu’minin, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that it is detestable to shave a dead persons’ pubic hair, when giving Ghusl (bath), cut his nails or trim his hairs.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/332)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ مِهْزَمٍ عَنْ طَلْحَةَ بْنِ زَيْدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كُرِهَ أَنْ يُقَصَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ ظُفُرٌ أَوْ يُقَصَّ لَهُ شَعْرٌ أَوْ تُحْلَقَ لَهُ عَانَةٌ أَوْ يُغْمَضَ لَهُ مَفْصِلٌ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Mahboub, from Ibrahim Bin Mahziyar, from Talha Bin Zayd,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘It is disliked to shorten the nails of the deceased, or shorten his hair, or shave off his pubic hair, or close down a joint of his’.
en.sarwar: 3. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from ibn Mahbub from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn Mahziyar from Talhah ibn Zayd who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Cutting the fingernails of a dead person, trimming hairs or shaving pubic hairs or softening body joints are detested matters.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/333)

parts.text: عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ

narrator_chain.text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْكِنْدِيِّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ الْمِيثَمِيِّ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْمَيِّتِ يَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ الشَّعْرُ فَيُحْلَقُ عَنْهُ أَوْ يُقَلَّمُ قَالَ لَا يُمَسُّ مِنْهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ اغْسِلْهُ وَ ادْفِنْهُ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Al Hassan Bin Muhammad Al Kindy, from Ahmad Bin Al Hassan Al Maysami, from Aban Bin Usman, from Abdul Rahman Bin Abu Abdullah who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the decease who happens to have the hair upon him, so can it be shaved off from it or clipped?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Do not touch anything from him. Wash him and bury him’.
en.sarwar: 4. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from al-Hassan ibn Muhammad al-Kindiy from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan al-Mithamiy from Aban ibn ‘Uthman from ‘Abd al-Rahman ibn abu ‘Abd Allah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a dead person whose body has hairs if it is required to shave or trim them. He (the Imam) said, ‘Nothing as such must be touched. Just give him Ghusl (bath) and bury.’”
